Container.Name: plex-generate-previews
Container.Overview:
Generate video preview thumbnails (BIF files) for Plex Media Server with GPU acceleration support.
Features: - Web UI with setup wizard for easy configuration - Plex OAuth authentication (no manual token needed) - GPU acceleration (NVIDIA, Intel QuickSync, AMD) - Background processing with job queue - Real-time progress display - Scheduled generation via cron expressions - Browser notifications when jobs complete
The web interface is available at http://[IP]:8080 after starting the container. A setup wizard will guide you through connecting to your Plex server.
IMPORTANT - NETWORKING: If your Plex container uses a custom network (like br1 or macvlan), this container must use the SAME network to communicate with Plex. Change the Network Type setting to match your Plex container's network.
For Intel QuickSync, /dev/dri is passed through automatically (see GPU Device below).
For NVIDIA GPU support, you must: 1. Install NVIDIA driver and nvidia-container-toolkit on Unraid 2. Add --runtime=nvidia to Extra Parameters 3. Or use the Nvidia-Driver and nvidia-container-toolkit plugins from Community Applications

Config.Name: Plex URL
Config.Description: URL to your Plex Media Server (use IP address, not localhost)

Config.Name: Plex Token
Config.Description: Plex authentication token. Find it at: https://support.plex.tv/articles/204059436-finding-an-authentication-token-x-plex-token/

Config.Name: Media Path
Config.Description: Path to your media files on Unraid (read-only)

Config.Name: Plex Data Path
Config.Description: Path to Plex application data where previews will be stored

Config.Name: Config Path
Config.Description: Path to store configuration, schedules, and job history

Config.Name: Media Path (Container)
Config.Description: How the container sees the media path (usually /media)

Config.Name: Plex Path Prefix
Config.Description: If Plex sees media at a different path than this container, enter the Plex path here

Config.Name: Auth Token Override
Config.Description: Optional: Set a fixed authentication token. If empty, a random token is generated (check logs)

Config.Name: Web Port
Config.Description: Internal port for web server (usually matches Web UI Port)

Config.Name: PUID
Config.Description: User ID for file permissions (99 = nobody on Unraid)

Config.Name: PGID
Config.Description: Group ID for file permissions (100 = users on Unraid)

Config.Name: Intel GPU Device
Config.Description: Pass through Intel GPU for QuickSync acceleration
